--- title: "EAMENA" subtitle: "**Documenting Endangered Archaeology and Cultural Heritage**" author: - name: Thomas Huet affiliation: - id: uo name: University of Oxford title-slide-attributes: data-background-image: "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/eamena-project/eamena-arches-dev/master/www/eamenaDB-bck-2.png" data-background-size: "90%" data-background-opacity: "0.7" format: revealjs: css: https://zoometh.github.io/thomashuet/css/quarto.css controls: true auto-stretch: false code-fold: false code-summary: "Code" slide-number: true chalkboard: theme: "whiteboard" color: ['rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.3)'] # red scrollable: true preview-links: auto # reference-location: document footnotes-hover: true logo: https://raw.githubusercontent.com/zoometh/thomashuet/master/img/inst-uni-oxford_.png footer: "DOCUMENTING COPTIC MONASTIC HERITAGE 11-13 November 2024, Bibliotheca Alexandrina, Alexandria, Egypt" margin: 0 width: 1200 --- # The project {background-image="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/eamena-project/eamena-arches-dev/master/talks/2024-chma/img/MAA44922_006_JMCK_428-036_pp_caption.jpg"} ::: {.cell} ::: ## Endangered Archaeology in Middle East and North Africa (EAMENA)
Smoke billows from the site of an Israeli airstrike on the Lebanese city of Baalbeck in the Bekaa Valley [Issued on: 23/09/2024 - 09:04 Modified: 24/09/2024 - 04:58] © Nidal SOLH / AFP
## Who we are ::: {.panel-tabset} ### Institutions ```{mermaid} flowchart TD subgraph EA[EAMENA] id1[University of Oxford] id2[University of Leicester] id3[University of Durham] end id1 ---> id6[EAMENA Database] id2 ---> id6 id3 ---> id6 subgraph MA[MAREA] id4[University of Southampton] id5[Ulster University] end id4 ---> id6 id5 ---> id6 style EA color:#f6d6d6 style MA color:#f6d6d6 style id1 fill:#f6d6d6,stroke:#333,stroke-width:2px style id2 fill:#f6d6d6,stroke:#333,stroke-width:2px style id3 fill:#f6d6d6,stroke:#333,stroke-width:2px style id4 fill:#f6d6d6,stroke:#333,stroke-width:2px style id5 fill:#f6d6d6,stroke:#333,stroke-width:2px click id1 "https://www.ox.ac.uk/" _blank click id2 "https://le.ac.uk/" _blank click id3 "https://www.durham.ac.uk/" _blank click id4 "https://www.southampton.ac.uk/" _blank click id5 "https://www.ulster.ac.uk/" _blank ``` ### Birth date :::: {.columns} ::: {.column width="30%"} January 2015
project drafted in January 2014 ::: ::: {.column width="70%"}
'Terror in the Mosul Museum', published in 'The New Yorker', February 27, 2015
::: ::: ::: ## Aims ::: {.panel-tabset} ### Documenting :::: {.columns} ::: {.column width="30%"} - Rapidly assess the status of the archaeological landscape (built heritage) - Provide access to a set of data on endangered heritage (Open Access) ::: ::: {.column width="70%"}
Temple of Bel, Palmyra, Syria, year 2014 (left) and 2016 (right) © Google Earth
::: ::: ### Training :::: {.columns} ::: {.column width="50%"}
Cultural Protection Fund (CPF) training in Amman (Jordan), December 2021
::: ::: {.column width="50%"}
Field assessment training, World Heritage Site of Um er-Rasas (Jordan)
::: ::: ### Leveraging :::: {.columns} ::: {.column width="33%"}
Jordan Antiquities Database Information System (JADIS) information system, 1990-95
::: ::: {.column width="33%"}
Middle East Geodatabase for Antiquities Jordan (MEGA Jordan), 2011-...
::: ::: {.column width="33%"}
Jordan Masdar (Arches v5), 2021-...
::: ::: ::: ## Limits ::: {.panel-tabset} ### Institutional Actors :::: {.columns} ::: {.column width="50%"}
"Protection of Syria’s Cultural Heritage in Times of Armed Conflict" e-learning course for Syrian cultural heritage professionals (ICOMOS - ICCROM)
::: ::: {.column width="50%"} ```{=html} ```
Weiss, Thomas G., et al. Cultural heritage and mass atrocities. Getty Publications, 2022
::: :::: ### XXX ::: ## Funders
Arcadia Fund, A charitable fund of Lisbet Rausing & Peter Baldwin


British Council Cultural Protection Fund ## EAMENA project (2/2) ::: {.panel-tabset} ### Geographical coverage :::: {.columns} ::: {.column width="30%"} Middle East North Africa (MENA) region ::: ::: {.column width="70%"}
EAMENA Grid Squares projected on Google Earth
::: ::: ### Temporal coverage :::: {.columns} ::: {.column width="30%"} Paleolithic -- World War II ::: ::: {.column width="70%"}
EAMENA periods (after 0 AD) © PeriodO
::: ::: ### Database
EAMENA Heritage Places counts in 2024
::: ## EAMENA database ::: {.panel-tabset} ### Open Access :::: {.columns} ::: {.column width="30%"}
Batist, Z.; Roe, J., 2024. Open archaeology, open source? Internet Archaeology 67. 10.11141/ia.67.13


Adapted from openarchaeo-collaboration. Graph of open archaeological GitHub repositories and connected users via contributions. Darker edges indicate a higher number of contributions. The color of the nodes indicates membership in the largest groups according to the method of edge betweenness without isolated nodes.
::: ::: {.column width="70%"} ```{=html}

``` ::: # Disturbances and Threats ## Disturbances/Threats definition ## Disturbances/Threats cases ::: {.panel-tabset} ### War :::: {.columns} ::: {.column width="60%"}
Destruction of the Temple of Bel by ISIS on August 23, 2015 (Palmyra, Syria)
::: ::: {.column width="40%"} ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}
``` ::: ::: ::: :::: ### Agriculture :::: {.columns} ::: {.column width="60%"}
Development of ploughed fields and orchards around and within an archaeological site (Udhma, Jordan)
::: ::: {.column width="40%"} ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}
``` ::: ::: ::: :::: ### Construction :::: {.columns} ::: {.column width="60%"}
Road over a section of an exposed church excavation (Ma'in, Jordan) ©APAAME .
::: ::: {.column width="40%"} ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}
``` ::: ::: ::: :::: ### Natural :::: {.columns} ::: {.column width="60%"}
The rising sea waters slowly washed away the Temple of Isis (Sabratha, Libya)
::: ::: {.column width="40%"} ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}
``` ::: ::: ::: :::: ### Looting :::: {.columns} ::: {.column width="60%"}
Looting and Illegal Activities destroying Deir Abu Lifa 1, Fayoum, Egypt ©Jan Ciglenečki, Coptic Monastic Heritage Archive
::: ::: {.column width="40%"} ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}
``` ::: ::: ::: :::: ::: ::: {.notes} Destruction: iconoclasm, looting, etc. ::: ## Disturbances/Threats assessment ```{=html} ``` # Database Issues & Developments {background-image="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/eamena-project/eamena-arches-dev/master/www/23889489303_b3df7d8cef_o.jpg"} {data-visibility=hidden} ## Disturbances and Threats {data-visibility=hidden} ::: {.panel-tabset} ### Looting :::: {.columns} ::: {.column width="60%"}
Looting of the Assyrian site of Yasin Tepe (Sulaymaniyah, Iraq)
::: ::: {.column width="40%"} ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}
``` ::: ::: ::: :::: ::: :::

include-after-body:
<script>
  // htmlwidgets need to know to resize themselves when slides are shown/hidden.
  // Fire the "slideenter" event (handled by htmlwidgets.js) when the current
  // slide changes (different for each slide format).
  (function () {
    // dispatch for htmlwidgets
    function fireSlideEnter() {
      const event = window.document.createEvent("Event");
      event.initEvent("slideenter", true, true);
      window.document.dispatchEvent(event);
    }

    function fireSlideChanged(previousSlide, currentSlide) {
      fireSlideEnter();

      // dispatch for shiny
      if (window.jQuery) {
        if (previousSlide) {
          window.jQuery(previousSlide).trigger("hidden");
        }
        if (currentSlide) {
          window.jQuery(currentSlide).trigger("shown");
        }
      }
    }

    // hookup for slidy
    if (window.w3c_slidy) {
      window.w3c_slidy.add_observer(function (slide_num) {
        // slide_num starts at position 1
        fireSlideChanged(null, w3c_slidy.slides[slide_num - 1]);
      });
    }

  })();
</script>
